experience: You and Stephanie both know Steven Roberts, Trish Bear, and 56 others
Casa Center for Positive Social Change

Coordinate and Manage the integration of Casa prevention programs into AZ Schools, businesses and other organizations teaching students, teachers, and familiies social and emotional intelligence and healthy relationship skills.   Direct and manage agency in accordance with the goals, objectives and policies of Casa and its Board of Directors.  Prepare budgets for approval by the Board.Oversee the planning and administration of fundraising.Oversee monthly Board meetings, reporting Casa's business activities and financial status.Through her administration Casa has: Reached over 900,000 children through Casa's prevention education programs to teach knowledge and skills to increase their social and emotional intelligence and healthy relationship skills and to prevent them from becoming victims of abuse, to prevent them from becoming abusive, bullying people, and to prevent them from getting involved in abusive relationships,        Opened two valley victim Advocacy Centers serving child and adult victims of sexual abuse, sexual assault and domestic violence, as a one-stop site providing full criminal investigation, medical exam  and victim advocacy services,Maintained the largest volunteer run victim advocacy network in AZ for 28 years,assisting over 150,000 callers as Central and Northern Arizona's only sexual assault and sexual abuse 24-hour hotline, and 6,000 victims of sexual abuse and sexual assault as the County's only 24-Hour Hospital Emergency Room Advocacy. Provided individual and group counseling services for over 40,000 children, teens and adults
Boys and Girls Club of the East Valley

Planned and implemented organizational policies and procedures. Coordinated activity of the Board of Directors, provided direction to standing board committees.  Planned, organized and administered comprehensive fundraising programs, including special events, direct mail campaign, corporate and foundation grants. Directed personnel administration for 14 full-time and over 100 part-time employees.  Managed marketing programs, prepared brochures, newsletters, PSAs, commercials, and billboard assignments.  Coordinated annual United Way budget and presentation proposals.  Assisted in the development and administration of $1.2 million annual budget.  Supervised administrative support staff, including bookkeeping and management of computer operations.  Coordinated concessions volunteer program with over 800 volunteers. Wrote all grant proposals, service contracts and requests for corporate donation. Organized annual meetings, developed the annual report.

Coordinated and supervised placement for over 1,200 graduates per year, achieving an average of 85% placement.  Hired, trained and supervised counseling staff and placement assistants. Administered on-campus recruitment program, scheduling and coordinating 260 companies each year.  Developed training materials and video instruction.  Assisted Director in development of department budget and policies and procedures.  Conducted individual and group presentations to corporate recruiters on the DeVRY curriculum.
Director of Career Placement for Computer Science
Taught graduates how to write resumes, interview and search for employment
Served as Career Specialist in the Career Services Department, conducting daily workshops.

recommendations: Marla Quattrone
Chief Strategic Brand Strategist
June 14, 2011, Stephanie was a client of Marla’s

Where do I begin singing the praises of Marla Matson-Quattrone's work as a branding and strategic marketing expert? I simply find her to be at the highest rung of her trade. Marla's incredible effectiveness is a result of the combination of her personality: positive, uplifting, and she has a highly exuberant perspective on life's potential, coupled with her extremely inquisitive nature and superior listening skills. This combination of skills allows her to grasp the true essence of the project she is branding. Marla then tops those skills with enormous creative talent which is always led by her principles to focus on an authentic message which calls to the heart and mind of the audience. She guides her clients to tell an emotionally moving story to achieve a unique, positive message. The key to success in marketing, and life, lies in positive personality traits, and Marla soars in them all. Plus, she is a just joy to work with! Oh, and there is one other important relational ingredient in which Marla excels — she is fun, fun, fun!!

Gelie Akhenblit
NetworkingPhoenix CEO l Tech Startup Co-Founder l Influencer l Mentor l  Community Leader l TEDx Presenter l Momma
June 30, 2009, Stephanie was a client of Gelie’s

I first attended one of Gelie's marketing seminars which was a training on LinkedIn!  There was over 100 in attendance and I was extremely impressed with her mastery of both the topic and faciliation of the workshop.    She is clearly a cutting-edge, top expert her in field with a solid grasp of marketing and the critical importance of developing a focused marketing strategy as the key to success for any marketing efforts!    I immediately asked for private consultation as a follow-up to her training.   I was extremely pleased at not only the cost effectiveness of her consulting time, but at the full focus during the session on Casa's needs, and strategy within a short amount of time.  One feels immediately Gelie's sincerity in helping people be successful with their business!  Most valuable, she gives not only her professional advice on where clients may benefit the most in their marketing efforts, but is very honest about those actions they may be taking which she does not believe is the best use of their resources; all in a very pleasant style!  We are thrilled with her advice and guidance, and look forward to our progress!

Karen LaVorgna
Tax Talent Acquisition Manager at PwC
April 2, 2009, Stephanie worked with Karen but at different companies

Through my 30 years of experience with non-profits, I can affirm that it is extremely rare to have someone walk in the door and offer to organize a fundraising event without non-profit staff  help!  For Casa, that person is Karen LaVorgna.  Six months ago, I met Karen when she presented me with her goal to organize a Casino night  to benefit Casa.  With our immediate approval, Karen hit the ground running chairing her March 11 Celebrity Casino night to benefit Casa.  She recruited her committee, scheduled planning meetings, secured the beautiful Wrigley Mansion as the venue, wrote letters soliciting silent auction items, prizes for winners, and raffle items. Karen also obtained numerous sponsors, supplying gifts for all their guests!  In addition, she and her committee solicited and received all donated appetizers from several generous Valley restaurants and grocers.  Karen topped off the evening with dynamic Matt and Ben from KNIX as MCs.   The event was attended by 300 very energetic people from Karen's extensive network of contacts and friends. The decor and atmosphere was electric and attendees raved about the event! At the end of the evening, Karen presented Casa with a donation of $15,000, which was exactly her goal! All who know her would confirm Karen is probably in the top 2% of energetic, "get it done" people.  Her follow through is unmatched and her commitment to meet her goals truly amazing. Karen's passion and determination to meet her goals allows her to accomplish anything she pursues. Casa is very grateful and fortunate Karen utilized her exemplary talents to raise money for Casa to prevent more children and teens from abuse and violence through our education programs!
Karen LaVorgna

Endorsed by 4 of Stephanie’s colleagues at Arizona State University
summary: I have been the Director of Casa Center for Positive Social Change since 1988.  The original mission of our agency was to provide crisis and counseling services however we have  transitioned over the years to our current mission which is to teach social and emotional intelligence education simultaneous to programs which prevent bullying, abuse and violence  to children, teens and adults.   We  teach emotional itelligence and healthy relationship skills to achieve positive, loving people while reducing emotional, verbal, sexual and physical abuse and violence to include bullying and cyber abuse.  To date Casa has presented its programs to over 950,000 children and adults  in area schools, and other children, teen and adult organizations. I  am also an AZ Action Leader for Liz Claiborne's "Love is Not Abuse" Prevention Program which teaches teen dating violence prevention.   My additional role as Director are in planning and management, fundraising, administration of accounting and finances, marketing and public/media relations, development of education curriculum, programs and services, and Board of Directors Administration.Specialties: emotional intelligence, bullying prevention, child abuse, sexual abuse, sexual assault, domestic violence,  offender behaviors
name: Stephanie Orr
title: Emotional Intelligence Trainer, EQ Leader and bullying reduction, positive relationships training, public speaking
